result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrell W Hodges was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
The first 21 days are straight time.  
Balance can be served with release privileges for the Day Reporting Program.  No objection to electronic monitoring while in the program.

miscConds.notes: Pay fine of $1,000.00 plus mandatory costs, assessments, drug surcharge, DNA surcharge and surcharges or a civil judgment to be entered against the defendant.
Court advised defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
Do not use or possess illegally controlled substances.
AODA, treatment or program.  Random screening.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darrell W Hodges

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 12 months at the House of Correction - the first 21 days are straight time - the balance can be served with release privileges for the Day Reporting Program - no objection to electronic monitoring while in the program.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years.

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay a fine of $1, 000 plus mandatory costs, assessments, drug surcharge, DNA surcharge and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) do not use or possess illegally controlled substances; 4) random screening; 5) AODA, treatment or program; 6) SERVE 5 DAYS at the House of Correction - straight time. 

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.

Defendant Darrell W Hodges in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Defendant Darrell W Hodges in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Laura Crivello.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 8/12/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 44.   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.  aw
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Darrell W Hodges in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsinfor Laura Crivello.
Defense counsel given time to go over discovery with client.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 6/23/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darrell W Hodges in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Ronald Dague for Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03 due to charges.  Case was incorrectly assigned.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 05-27-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Darrell W Hodges
Current: 201 Kettle Moraine Drive, Eagle, WI 53119   (Effective: 05-19-2015)
Prior: 108 Waukesha Road, Eagle, WI 53119

As an additional condition of bail:
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No drugs without a valid prescription

No firearms
No dangerous weapons

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Darrell W Hodges in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-096

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Clerk:  jms
Summons mailed.  Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5-19-2015 at 1:30pm
